intro: Nelsonia canescens var. vestita, commonly known as the silver-haired Nelsonia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its drought tolerance. The variety 'vestita' is distinguished by its more pronounced silver foliage compared to the typical form.
